org.jpac.plc

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.plc.Data

  • public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
    used as a data storage for data interchanged with a plc.
    Implements a byte array and some accessor methods for
    several plc side datatypes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Data

        public Data(byte[] bytes)
        constructor. The endianness of the data item is set to "big endian".
        Parameters:
        bytes -

      • Data

        public Data(byte[] bytes,
            Data.Endianness endianness)
        constructor
        Parameters:
        bytes -
        endianness - used to set the endianness of this data item. This setting decides if the bytes inside this data item are interpreted as little endian or big endian. The default is "big endian"

    • Method Detail

      • getBIT

        public boolean getBIT(int byteIndex,
                      int bitIndex)
               throws AddressException
        used to read a bit
        Parameters:
        byteIndex - byte offset inside the data buffer
        bitIndex - bit offset inside the byte referenced by byteIndex
        Returns:
        true: bit == 1, false: bit == 0
        Throws:
        AddressException

      • clear

        public void clear()
        used to clear the data buffer (all entries are set to 0x00). Next call to isModified() will return "true" if the data buffer is null, nothing happens

      • clear

        public void clear(byte pattern)
        used to clear the data buffer. Next call to isModified() will return "true" if the data buffer is null, nothing happens
        Parameters:
        pattern - the buffer is set to pattern

      • forceModified

        public void forceModified()
        used to to force the whole data item to be marked as changed

      • isModified

        public boolean isModified()
        returns the modified state of the data item.
        The first call following the instantiation or a setBytes(byte[] bytes) call
        will always return true to let observers synchronize to the new state.
        Returns:
        true, if the data has changed since the last call of isModified()

      • getModifiedByteIndices

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getModifiedByteIndices()
        returns a ArrayList containing the indices of the modified bytes inside this data item
        CAUTION: the ArrayList is computed on calling isModified(). To get an up to date ArrayList, call isModified() first.
        Returns:

      • copy

        public void copy(Data data)
        used to copy the bytes and the endianess of data. Afterwards this.isModified() will be true for the first call.
        Parameters:
        data -

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Data data)
        compares to data items
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:
        true, if the bytes of both data items contain identical data, and the endianness is identical, too.

           throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
